column1: leans in towards a fuller ball to just caress it through the covers. Just enough on it to beat the two fielders giving it chase
looped in towards off, driven to cover
short, curves into him and beats the flashing bat outside off
good length outside off, leans forward to bock to cover
back of a length, sliding in to leg, swivels and pulls off the backfoot over square leg
flashes outside off and gets a thick outside edge that runs away to third man
short of length outside off, blocked to point
full outside off, driven to mid-off
short of length, rides the bounce and stabs to point
full, angled in to off, driven dead straight and hitting the boot of the bowler before deflecting into the off side
good length on off, defends late and chops it towards slip
full on off, defended to mid-off
full outside off, driven in front of mid-off for a quick one
shortish, angled across, flashes and misses
length, on the pads, tucked to midwicket

back of a length, stops on him, nudges it right next to his right and takes off. Richardson runs forward and nails a <b>direct hit diving forward/,/b> but Weatherald has stretched forward fully and is fine
back of a length, mistimed defence from the crease
full, pushed across, heaves it away over the extra cover region without much timing
back of a length outside off, slashed to point
short of a length, angled in, tucked to midwicket
back of a length, pushes back and defends towards backward point with an open face
back of a length, thick outside edge as he flashes without much room, away to third man
full, angled into middle, chipped straight over, between mid-off and mid-on
stays legside of it and carves it away over backward point
fuller in the blockhole, digs it out to mid-off
short of length, looks to go big but doesn't get the timing right, a single down the ground
length around off, looks to push it towards covers, misses
short and wide and cuts it hard towards deep point for a run
angles a fuller one across off that's hoicked over the in-field. Not enough to go the distance. Lands in front and pulled back before the long-off boundary
makes room for a length ball and slaps it through the gap between gully and backward point
short of a length, slower, waits and stabs it through backward point
fuller, angled into middle, pushed to mid-on..no-ball called because only three fielders inside the circle
goes for a yorker and it's squeezed out wide of long-on
slower short ball, waits and pulls to deep square leg
short, not enough room and he chops a slap towards the cover region
full, dipping on middle and leg, clipped behind square leg
angled down leg
gets down for a big slog and mistimes to deep midwicket
tucked into the leg side
backs away and slaps through the off side
short, rocks back and heaves a pull well over deep midwicket
width on offer, slapped to a diving point
pitched up outside off, slogged straight into the hands of deep midwicket
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
floated up too far across off, crunched to sweeper cover
pushed across full, forward to defend
presses forward and knocks it to short third man off the outside of the bat
full and flat, stays back and nudges into the on side
short and angled into him, pulled over cow corner
full on middle and off, jabbed back
length, closes the face and inside-edges to the pad
shortish, pushes back and keeps it out
short, pitching outside leg, pulls without timing to deep backward square
short of length, pitching outside leg, defended
full outside off, slapped to the sweeper at cover
pitched up outside off, driven to extra cover
length on middle, defended back
slanted across, reverse-sweeps to the third man region
miscued in the air. Slanted across and he swipes across the line to get a leading edge that cover runs back to settle under
shuffles across to a length ball and tucks to midwicket
short of a length, spinning in from outside off, tucked to midwicket
rocks back to a short one and muscles a pull over deep midwicket
nudged to midwicket
shuffles across and punches a length ball to mid-on

drops it into the off side for a very quick one, but has there been a run out? TV umpire summoned. Oh, yes, he's gone! Dives forward with the left hand holding the bat stretched out but bat's in the air, though it's past the line. Gone! Mindless attempt at a single
pushed across outside off, slapped to deep cover
slides it full into leg stump, clipped to wide long-on
pitched up outside off, driven to deep cover
slanted across off, chops a cut
gets down to reverse sweep and misses
pitched up outside off, driven to long-off
short, too far across, not called wide
backs away and ends up having to reach out and swipe at it, misses
back of a length, reaches out for a slap to deep cover
good length on off, presses forward to defend to point
full, pushed across off, driven to extra cover
fuller of a length, pinches a single to mid-off
pitched up on middle, driven wide of long-off
full outside off, reverse-swept past the keeper
full, middle and leg, eased down to long-on
another reverse sweep, this time fine of short third man
sees him advance and drops it short, cut to point
sliding fuller one, tries to sweep and misses
full on middle, clipped to long-on

slashes at a shortish one and gets an outside edge to third man. They push back for the third and Harper gathers the throw to disturb the stumps. Reckon that's on the line. Yep, given out! Very very close, but the correct decision in the end. Another needless run out, and this time it's the set Weatherald
nudged into on side
flat length ball, tucked to midwicket
back of a length, middle and leg, defended back
full, curving into middle and leg, driven back
back of a length, punched to mid-on
short, pulled through square leg
short of good length on off, opens the face to short third man
full, dipping on middle, driven to mid-on
tries to pull this short one but fails to get on top of the bounce

tame! Just chips this fuller one straight back to give Christian catching practice. Closes the face early as he had dragged the pace off, so that certainly played a part. Bit of a leading edge and no problems for Christian
good length on off, defended
short outside off, backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, slapped to deep backward point
short, down the ground and making room as he slaps to deep cover
short of length, tucked off the pads to square leg
short of good length outside off, punched to point
shortish, backs away and slaps to deep cover
yorker, dug out down the ground
full, launches it with the angle to deep square leg
backs away to a fuller one and mows it through long-off
full toss on off, backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
razor sharp angles on off, closes the face and wears it on the pad. Plumb in front
slapped to deep cover
full on off, driven to long-on
drags a pull from outside off and launches this over deep square leg. Goes miles!
down the ground and inside-out through extra cover, beats long-off diving to the left
full outside off, swung away over backward point
dips outside off and beats the bat but the keeper fumbles and they steal a bye
full, angled into off, whipped into on side
dips on him outside off.. another bye
backs away and swings wildly to just about clear the point boundary
follows him swing and a miss. More extras as they take off
slaps a full toss through point
slanted across off, flashes and misses
short of a length, whipped away to deep midwicket
short of length, skids on with zero turn, inside-edged onto the pad as he backs away
short of a length again, stabbed to point
fuller outside off, reverse-swept fine of third man
back of a length, whipped to long-on
full outside off, presses forward and drills it back
full around off, driven straight back
short of a length on off, punched to cover
tucked off the backfoot behind square leg
length, jabbed to cover
bit of width as he slashes to point
flicked off the pads over the in-field at square leg
swipes across the line and gets a top-edge that drops short of third man charging forward
gets him to nick through. Flashing outside off as this one's angled across and gets enough bounce to leave him uncomfortable as he's trying to run that down to third man. Simple catch to keeper
back of a length outside off, defended to point
walks across and opens the face to third man

collision between keeper and short fine leg but Carey holds on. Harper gets down to scoop this fine but can't quite find the middle of the bat, Carey moves back and across and holds on despite tumbling
full, middle and leg, drilled to midwicket
short, keeps the bat down as it goes down leg
back of a length, shuffles across and defends
length on off, opens the face to backward point
length outside off, pushed to point
length on middle, defended
shortish outside off, stabbed to point
short of a length around off, slapped to point
good length around off, jabbed straight back and knocks the stumps
outside edge past the keeper diving to his left as he tries to arch back and deal with the bounce on this one
nudged into on side
full around off, backs away and thumps it over the in-field at cover
length on off, tucked to midwicket
length, punched to long-on
flicks a fuller one to square leg
full, angled in, gets down and sweeps it over deep backward square
short of length outside off, cracks it off the backfoot through point
<b>very, very soft</v>. Short of a length, extra bounce and stops on him a little, just checks his stroke as he punches at it and pops a simple catch to cover
spins in, googly, tucked to leg side
backs away and slaps a short one to the left of deep cover
short of length, moves away and jabs it back
swipes at a length ball and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
back of a length, angled in, pulled to deep square leg
down to sweep to the wrong length, nowhere full enough, lobs behind the stumps off the glove
ripper! Spins off a length outside off, he tries to close the face and gets beaten big time
tries to pull but can't quite middle it as it doesn't come on
plumb! Another sweep attempted, not full again.. he's struggled to pick the legnths here. On a length and a googly, going on with the arm to hit middle and leg
length on off, defended
back of a length, stays back and tucks to the right of the bowler
full around off, clipped to midwicket
tries to cut and misses
short, stopping on him, slapped to long-off
shifts back and tucks it to right of the bowler
shifts back and defends back
straight through! Tossed up, inviting the big swipe, which Nabi does but doesn't manage to get underneath it and the ball crashes into the stumps. Renegades putting on a sorry display here!
short, no turn, whipped to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven past the right of extra cover
flat, back of a length, whipped away behind square
short of length, spinning in, jabbed back
wrong'un, tucked with the turn to square leg
tossed up on middle, clipped to midwicket
floats up a full toss, punched down to long-on
turned away off the pads to square leg

comes down the ground and yorks himself.. not much he can do from that position, toe-ends it into the surface as it goes on to clatter into the stumps. Renegades unravelling spectacularly. Will they last 20 overs?
back of a length, flat, spins down leg
full outside off, opens the face to drive behind point
pitched up outside off, opens the face to third man
spins into the pads, tucked behind square
short of a length outside off, cut off the backfoot
full outside off, opens the face to point
turns this away behind square
shuffles across and whips this length ball towards mid-on
high full toss, whips it away through backward square leg. Not called a no-ball but he had stepped down the ground
full on off, pushed to extra cover
that's huge! Waist-high full toss, smokes it miles over deep midwicket
spins down leg from a length
spins away from a length, defended
sliding towards leg, nudged into square leg
dragged on, or has he? Carey says no, indicating he may have inadvertently tipped the bails off. Actually, he has dragged the sweep onto Carey's boot before it goes onto the stumps
googly, back of a length, tucked to deep midwicket
gets down to sweep but he had taken a stride across and the impact was outside off
good length on off, defended
walks across and taps it into leg side
yorker on off, dug out to cover and beats the diving fielder's throw for a quick one
short around off, slapped to sweeper cover
advances and slaps a short one to the right of sweeper cover
short of a length, goes over the stumps as he swings
comes down the ground and clips it to deep midwicket
gets down to sweep behind square
shifts back and tucks but inside-edges onto the pad
shout for lbw, looks close, not given, but it was probably heading down leg
gets down for a big slog sweep and misses
full outside off, drilled to wide long-on
full outside off, slapped down to long-on
short, follows him as he backs away and hits the solar plexes as he tries to pull
thumped! Goes over the bowler's ear as he barely has enough time to get out of the way of this tonk!
and the bowler has the last laugh. Cleans him up next ball. Sower ball, Wildermuth's backing away and can't put bat to ball
full outside off, drilled away to third man off the outside of the bat
full toss, drilled away to deep backward point
back of a length, down to sweep and misses and it's it him a little high, so lbw call withheld. Might've been going down leg too
down the ground and carved away over extra cover, beats long-off to his left
down the ground and slapped to deep point
advances and drills it to long-on who slides and just about gets to it
full outside off, clipped to wide long-on
back of a length, angling in, pulled one-bounce to deep square leg
full outside off, swipes big and shovels it over deep square leg
another one, or is it? Oh, yeah! Just about enough to get it over the man stationed in the deep. Short, pulled over deep square leg
dead plumb. A yorker that the batsman fails to clip away and hits him in front of middle
full on middle, driven down the ground
full, curving away a bit, swipes down the ground for four
full, angling into leg, clipped behind square leg
length on off, shovels it without getting hold of it entirely and sends a catch down the throat of long-on
slow full toss, pushed to long-off
full around off, backs away and carves it through cover and point
full, angling in, mowed to long-on who almost lets it go through
full outside off, carves it away over the in-field, one-bounce to the sweeper at cover
